normalised: Reports are flooding in about a recent ceremony held at the Indian Military Academy. Seems like several officers have been promoted, you know, the usual rigmarole. But hey, it is important stuff! Specifically, sources say Lieutenant General Sharma, previously commanding a key sector along the border, has now been elevated to the position of General Officer Commanding-in-Chief. Big deal, right? Heard murmurs he has got some serious experience under his belt. Also, apparently, one Captain Verma, who is quite popular amongst the troops, got a medal for bravery. Good for him! And Wing Commander Mehra is said to have played a vital role in the recent joint military exercise with the French forces. A real feather in his cap! Overall, a proud day for the Indian Army, with names like Major Khan and Subedar Singh also grabbing headlines for their achievements. Let us hope these promotions bring in even more effectiveness in safeguarding our nation. Jai Hind!
